page.title: 06Farming in Chinley
page.content: Many of the small-holdings and even the larger farms in Chinley are finding it very difficult to break even, for as Common Market (E.E.C.) quotas on milk decrease, cutting the size of the milking herd is sometimes the only answer. Other problems arise from the hilly landscape, which makes it very difficult, or even impossible, to cultivate crops other than grass. Weather is also against the farmers, as frequent downpours can destroy winter feed, making it impossible to dry the grass and turn it into hay. We certainly seem to have more than our fair share of wet and blustery weather in the Blackbrook Valley! by{Ian Ripley
